referable-content.title: [RC concept] HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade System / Hardware Requirements [main stream]

rcbody.shortdesc: For successful software installation and operation, the Titanium Server hardware platform must meet specific requirements.

conbody.p: For system planning considerations, refer to the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade Administration Guide: Configuration Planning. For help with performance calculations, refer to the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade System Engineering Guidelines.

section.title: System Architecture
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system consists of a set of hosts connected to internal and external networks, as illustrated in the following figure.

note.p: For a minimal two-server configuration, the controller and compute functions are combined on a single host.

li.p: For systems using storage nodes, two storage nodes are required.

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade runs on all x86-64 processors that support Intel Virtualization Technology (VT) VT-x/VT-d extensions. However, the Titanium Server kernel has been optimized specifically for the Intel Xeon-core family of processors.

note.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade controllers use IP multicast messaging on the management, infrastructure, and OAM networks. To prevent loss of controller synchronization, ensure that the switches and other devices on these networks are configured with appropriate settings.

section.title: System / BIOS Requirements
section.p: The BIOS on each host must support PXE booting for initial installation of the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade software.

note.p: Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) mode is not supported. Ensure that the host is set to use Legacy BIOS mode. For details, refer to the documentation supplied with your hardware.

section.p: The actual memory requirement for production environments depends on the expected load. In particular, for compute nodes, the memory requirement depends on the expected number of virtual machines and the types of application running on them.

section.title: Storage Requirements
section.p: The storage requirements for HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade depend on the system scale.

li.p: For small-scale solutions, the use of LVM/iSCSI shares on the controller node is required. Storage nodes are not required.
For large-scale solutions, the use of Ceph storage on dedicated storage nodes is recommended. This type of system can be scaled upwards using additional disks on the storage nodes.
For very large-scale deployments using external distributed file systems, contact Professional Services.

section.p: All hosts require one system disk where the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade system software is installed. System disks are automatically partitioned by the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installer program.
Controller nodes require an additional physical disk for volume storage. Storage nodes require an additional physical disk for OSD storage.

section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade uses distributed replicated block device (DRDB) technology to automatically synchronize the hard drives across the two controller nodes.

section.title: Ethernet Interfaces
section.p: All hosts in the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade cluster connect to at least the internal management network using an Ethernet interface. The ports used for this connection must support network booting, and must be configured as the primary booting device for installation. In most BIOS/UEFI implementations, only on-board ports can be configured for network booting.
HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade supports provisioning multiple ports on supported NICs.

note.p: For a Mellanox CX3, all ports must be used either for data interfaces, or for non-data interfaces. It is not possible to use some ports for data interfaces and others for non-data interfaces on the same Mellanox CX3 NIC.

section.title: Board Management Modules
section.draft-comment: US64066 adds Quanta; US64069 mentions sensor capabilities
section.p: For out-of-band reset, power-on/power-off, or performance sensor capabilities, HP iLO3 or iLO4 (Integrated Lights Out), or Quanta board management modules are required. Hardware sensor monitoring and reporting is supported for Quanta modules.

section.title: USB Interface
section.p: For the controller, a USB interface is required for backup and restore operations, and for software installation if a DVD is not available.
